intro: Nonea nigricans subsp. violacea, commonly known as the violet-stemmed Nonea, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive violet or purple stems and leaves. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
